Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Elizabeth Shelby
Description:
This card is the "flex" prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Resource Rumble."

Unique Federation Crew (2 SP)
When defending, your ship may reroll one of your blank results.  If the attacking ship is a Borg ship, you may roll an extra defense die and reroll all of your blank results instead.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Sabotaged Systems
Description:
This card is the competitive prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Resource Rumble."

Unique Independent Tech (3 SP)
During the planning phase, you may discard Sabotaged Systems and target an opposing ship within range 3.  Switch that ship's Primary Weapon and Agility Values until the end of the round.

Name: CXG-027 Computer Naval Battle Game
Description: This is an electronic battleship game.  Object is for one player to destroy all opponent's ships.

Name: Star Wars Trivia Card Game
Description:
Are you a Jedi Master? How much do you really know about Star Wars?

This galactic quiz game is the perfect way to put your powers to the test and show off your Star Wars knowledge.

Trivia based on episodes I-VI

—description from the publisher

Name: EtheoryEm
Description: EtheoryEm is a music theory and worker placement game in which players take control of musicians attempting to earn a seat in the prestigious Ethereum Orchestra.  Each turn, players choose to perform one of several actions, such as Practice (placing, rolling and shifting notes on the chromatic scale), Audition (attempting to secure a chair in the orchestra by completing objective chords and scales using those notes), Tenure (solidifying their seat in the orchestra and improving their influence within it) and Performance (randomly determined action points where the musicians must perform masterpieces to prove their skill and keep their positions).  As the orchestra is ultimately filled, players tally victory points to determine the winner based on the chords & scales successfully completed, their musician presence and location within the orchestra, as well as additional hidden objectives.

Name: Snow Day: A Snowman-Building Card Game
Description:
Players compete to be the first to build a snowman in this fun and thematic card game.  Be the first to build all three pieces of your snowman and collect all 7 item cards to win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Lu Jun Qi Zodiac Game
Description:
This set sold as é™¸è»æ£‹â€§åäºŒç”Ÿè‚–æ£‹ is supplied with 50 paper army tokens for playing a variant of Lu Jun Qi, and 50 paper animal tokens for playing a game similar to Dou Shou Qi. The board is not the same as the usual board for either game: it's 7x10 with a central river, and with all four corners missing.

The army pieces are numbered in Chinese numerals, and each side has one each of 1, 2, two each of 3, 4, 5, 6, three each of 7, 8, 9, plus three mines, two rockets and one flag.

The animal pieces are numbered in Western numerals in Chinese Zodiac order, and each side has two each of Rat (1) through Pig (12), plus three bullets.

Name: Shield
Description:
Shield is a 2-4 player turn-based card game with multiple game modes. Choose a character and keep your shields bolstered with a multitude of elements. Harness the power of your character's native element and use your native abilities to wreak havoc on your opponents!

Your Shield is comprised of three 'Lanes'. If any one of these Lanes is left unoccupied, you Adventurer will become vulnerable to direct hits. Keep them covered to stay alive. Some Adventurers start with only one Shield layer of element cards. Others start at the maximum of three Shield layers of element cards.

The Element deck is comprised of thirteen Elements, all with strengths and vices (relative to other Elements). Use these elements to form your Shield, and to strike other players' Shields. A pair of elements will allow you to use your Adventurer's Ability. If the pair is a native element of your Adventurer, then you may use your Adventurer's Native Ability. You may also double strike with a pair of element cards. You may also deflect strikes by discarding one of your native element cards.

Standard play has one player play as Death against the other three players. Death has four cards in their starting hand and two actions per turn while the other players have three cards in their starting hand and one action per turn. As players are eliminated, the other players playing against Death level up, first to utilize a 4-card hand and next to take two actions per turn. The last player standing wins the game and may become Death in the following game, if they wish to. A 2-player game has both players starting with the same 4-card hand and two action turn.

Name: Abducted Cow
Description:
Abducted Cow is a 2-5 player tactical sci-fi card game.
You play the role of the alien controlling a UFO. Coming to earth you develop an unhealthy fascination for the creatures we call cows. It is a race with your opponents to fill your ship with these animals. To win, you attack, defend and steal the cows of your opponents.

The card draw pile is composed of 4 categories of card: attack, steal, defend and utility. Attack cards kill cows; defend cards defend your cows; steal cards steal the cows of your opponents; and utility cards influence gameplay. You draw to a limit of 3 cards at the start of your turn. In addition, you take one cow token and one energy token from the main supply.

Each card has an energy cost associated with it, with more powerful cards costing more energy. Energy may also be acquired through utility cards, discarding a single card at the end of your turn or discarding 2 cards during. 
The winner is the player who acquires 10 cows, or the most cows once the card draw pile is depleted.

—description from the designer

Name: Klunker
Description:
This game is a reimplementation of the earlier version of Klunker.  Like the original, it shares features with the designer's earlier game, Bohnanza.

In Klunker, players are collecting jewelry (instead of planting beans).  Instead of trading cards with each other, players put some of their jewels up for sale to the other players.  In doing so, a player hopes to attract buyers by selling jewels their opponents might want - along with others that they might rather not get.

This new version differs from the original in the following ways:

     A different mix of jewelry cards.
     All jewel types are treated equally (in the original, converting necklaces to money was advantageous).
     With 5 players, players start with more money but pay a per-round "luxury tax."
     6-player rules are added in which players start with even more money but pay a higher tax.


—user summary

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Gathering Storm III – Rise of the Primarch
Description:
Rise of the Primarch is the third book in the Gathering Storm series. This 136-page hardback introduces the Triumvirate of the Primarch and draws the threads of the thrilling story of the Gathering Storm together in dramatic fashion.

Rise of the Primarch is packed with new rules content for Warhammer 40,000:

     Datasheets for the Triumvirate of the Primarch.
      Warlord Traits, Relics, Tactical Objectives and a Detachment for Ultramarines forces.
      Formations allowing you to field The Fallen, the Grey Knights’ Bulwark of Purity, the Victrix Guard of the Ultramarines and the Triumvirate of the Primarch.
     Daemonic Adversaries – special rules allowing you to field Grey Knights against enemies that are not necessarily Daemonic in nature.
      5 Echoes of War missions – key battles from Rise of the Primarch. 3 Cataclysm of War missions. Special objectives to be used when fielding Cypher and the Fallen.


—description from the publisher

Name: Aeon's End: Thieving Spirit
Description:
Promo card for The Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter.
Consists of 5 spell cards and 1 randomizer cards. These cards bear the ID P018 to P023

Thieving Spirit
Spell
Cost: 5 aether
Cast: Deal 4 damage. Gain 1 aether.

Name: Dilemma
Description:
You know, when you debate whether you should help that little old lady cross the street or instead run to catch your train on time? It’s the little Angel and Demon on your shoulders, whispering in your ears, both trying to influence you on a daily basis. 
Well, it’s about time the roles got reversed. Dilemma allows YOU to influence Angels and Demons! You can help decide which side will end up victorious!
Win the game by choosing the right side and collecting the most Feathers!

Dilemma is a card game for 4 to 9 players, and takes about 5 minutes per player.

The game is played over 5 rounds. In every round all players choose an Angel or a Demon card from their hand. In their turn, each player chooses another player to interact with. Depending on the outcome of the encounter, players will gain or lose Feathers, and/or will make Dennis the Dove move on the Dilemma track. If Dennis reaches a new card, an event will be triggered.

At the end of the 5th round, Dennis will declare which side is victorious,depending on the side he ended on: Angels or Demons. 
Out of the players who chose the victorious side, the TWO players with the most Feathers in their possession are declared the winners of the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Forager: The Napoleonic Skirmish Game
Description:
Forager is a fast fun, skirmish level wargame where deeds straight out of a Sharpe novel can come to life. Think of famous episodes portrayed on TV and in the written word, all those feats can be performed whilst playing a game of Forager, hiding, climbing, jumping, diving for cover to name a few. 
Forager is set out in a very similar way to Stand to Game’s Napoleonic ruleset Over the Hills, in that there is a basic rules section where you will find a few pages that once digested will allow you to play the game with confidence. The Optional rules are crammed packed with other rules that players can use to enhance their games of Forager, you will find rules for national characteristics for all the main players in the Napoleonic Wars, the United States, Canada and the Ottoman Empire.  Rules for mounted characters, fighting duals, giving orders and character advancement to name a few.

The appendices contain lists and details of the 75 character traits as well as a quick play sheet and several scenarios for you to get to grips with. Finally, to get you started there are two sets of character cards, one French command and one British command. These commands allow you to that you can get straight into the game with.

The basics of the game are as follows:

     Each force is called a command and is led by an officer/NCO and has several other soldiers, all being named characters.
     Each character has a Skill level and Combat Statistic, Field Craft and Fatigue Score.
     Characters can also be given Character Traits that shape how they fight during a game of Forager. 
     Characters can also be given Equipment that aids them during a game of Forager.


—description from the designer

Name: Purple People Eater
Description:
The ELECTRICALLY frightening 'feely' monster game of skill. For 2-4 players, 6 years and upwards.

Purple People Eater - is asleep. Can you save the people from his horrible clutches? If you wake him up you will hear him growl as his eye lights up in anger. Caught in his clutches you will feel his tentacles quiver on your hand. Will you be able to rescue the people through his gaping jaw? Take care, because if you wake him he will get very angry!!

Inspired by the song of the same name, players attempt to remove people from the monster's clutches without setting off an alarm.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bitcoin: The Board Game
Description:
Theme: Bitcoin/Cryptocurrency

Game-play: Each player has a token (game piece) and "wallet." The wallet is used to keep track of the players cash, bitcoin, and possibly bitcoin cash (if it gets forked into the game). Each player travels around the bitcoin playing board while trying to deal with positive news, negative news, and board spaces that lead to both positive and negative outcomes.

Object of Game: Travel around the Bitcoin Logo board and be the first player to amass a wallet size of $200,000 in fiat currency (US Dollars or one of 6 other currencies Euro, British Pound, Euro, Yen, Swiss Franc, Canadian Dollar, and Australian Dollar).

The ideal number of players is 3-4. There are 3 roles in the game. The main drivers of the game are: your decisions on buying, selling, and hodling bitcoin(bitcoin term for holding) and news cards that can dramatically affect the price of bitcoin both up and down.

The game is designed for ages 12+. Although the real bitcoin has many complex characteristics, Bitcoin The Board Game only focuses on the elements that a teenager can understand and grasp. The game is meant to be enjoyed with friends and family in a casual setting.

If you're like me, the 2017 holidays (US Thanksgiving and Christmas) were spent talking about bitcoin. This year, play the game! It will be available in time for the 2018 holidays.

—description from the designer

Name: Sagrada: 5-6 Player Expansion
Description:
Add to your Sagrada experience with the 5-6 Player Expansion!

You can now enjoy more Sagrada by adding up to 2 extra players! This expansion introduces the Private Dice Pool boards for smooth gameplay through 6 players. Also includes new private objectives, tools, and window pattern cards.

This expansion is not standalone. The Sagrada base game is required to play.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Pharisees: The Party Game
Description:
Family-friendly, party card game for 5-48 players. 
It's The Pharisees vs. The Disciples. It's like Mafia... but with a lot more Bible verses.

Picture this: you live in a distant land, many centuries ago. You’ve recently started following a controversial new prophet named Jesus...and the religious leaders of the day, the Pharisees, aren’t very happy about it. Each night, the Pharisees sneak into your community in search of a disciple to stone.

Each player has a mission. As a disciple, find and excommunicate the Pharisees. As a Pharisee, convince the disciples you're innocent while secretly trying to stone them each night, one by one. Dozens of special roles help both the disciples and Pharisees accomplish their missions.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Ixalan Planeswalker Deck: Huatli Dinosaur Knight
Description:
Includes:

2 Sun-Blessed Mount
1 Goring Ceratops
1 Burning Sun's Avatar
2 Kinjalli's Caller
4 Huatli's Snubhorn
2 Raptor Companion
2 Tilonalli's Knight
2 Frenzied Raptor
2 Territorial Hammerskull
2 Bonded Horncrest
2 Pterodon Knight
2 Shining Aerosaur
3 Huatli's Spurring
2 Slash of Talons
2 Lightning Strike
2 Rallying Roar
4 Stone Quarry
11 Mountain
11 Plains
1 Huatli, Dinosaur Knight

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Ixalan Planeswalker Deck: Jace Ingenious Mind-Mage
Description:
Includes:

1 Herald of Secret Streams
1 Fleet Swallower
2 Kumena's Speaker
2 Jungle Delver
2 Deeproot Warrior
3 Jace's Sentinel
2 Shaper Apprentice
2 Vineshaper Mystic
2 Shapers of Nature
2 Jade Guardian
2 Headwater Sentries
1 Tempest Caller
2 Air Elemental
2 Grasping Current
3 River Heralds' Boon
4 Castaway's Despair
4 Woodland Stream
11 Forest
11 Island
1 Jace, Ingenious Mind-Mage

Name: Build Up
Description:
Build Up is a domino game played with two sets of double six dominos.  Players take turns building stacks of dominos, scoring points at the end of each hand.  The winner is the player with the most points after three hands.

—description from the designer

Name: Marvel Dice Masters: Justice, Like Lightning... Team Pack
Description: The Marvel Dice Masters: Justice, Like Lightning… Team Pack includes members of the Thunderbolts team, with Citizen V, Songbird, and Techno all making an appearance. Team Packs each include 24 cards and 16 dice, representing eight different characters, and can be combined with any Dice Masters boxed set.

Name: Marvel Dice Masters: Kree Invasion Team Pack
Description: The Marvel Dice Masters: Kree Invasion Team Pack has characters from the Kree Empire as well as Guardians of the Galaxy characters, including Drax, the Supreme Intelligence, and Kree Soldiers. Team Packs each include 24 cards and 16 dice, representing eight different characters, and can be combined with any Dice Masters boxed set.

Name: Pillaging Maruaders
Description:
You are a space pirate trying to retrieve a treasure that was lost during a bitter battle many years ago. You need to return the loot to your own planet to win the game. Do you wait for them to find it and then wipe out their fleet? Or do you go for it and hope to make it back to your planet unscathed?
movement uses dice rolls to determine how far you can go.
movement is done with either one ship moving each dice in a single direction. or the same direction. or two seperate ships moving a direction based on one of the dice counts each.

https://www.facebook.com/PillagingMarauders/

Name: La bâtarde
Description:
"La bâtarde" (the bastard) is a French card game in the same style as Tarot, Coinche, Belote, a kind of traditional, trick-taking, card games.
Each player plays one card, either following suit of the same color if possible, playing a trump, or otherwise any other card - the card with the highest value scores the point. The unique gameplay is that players don't win by scoring points, you win by announcing how many points you will score, and it can be 0 !

An extract from the beginning of the rulebook : 
The Bastard one is a thrilling and mysterious card game.
Some  claim  that  a  primitive  version  originated  in  the  North  of India and arrived in Venice via Asia Minor, from where it spread through Europe. It is also told that it owes its name to the illegitimate  daughter  of  a  Syldavian  prince  who  introduced it to  his father’s court.
Others  maintain  that  three  Portuguese  sailors  brought  it  back from much further afield. 
But nothing is less sure...

In this game, there are no teams, it is every person for themselves. 
3 to 8 players can play.

Draw  to  designate  the  dealer  (highest  card).  Next  round  the  dealer  shifts clockwise.

Deal the cards face down, one by one.
A  “rubber”  is  a  set  of  games  made  up  of  several  “hands”  all  dealt  in  the same way.

After  each  hand  is  dealt,  the  players  look  at  their  cards  and  announce in advance the number of “tricks” that they think they will win. This is called “bidding”.
In this game you never pass. Each player bids on each round. 
The  bidding  system  leads  all  the  players  to  agree  on  which  “suit”  is  the “trump”, if any. 
There  are  6  possibilities:  all  cards  are  trump,  spades  are  trump,  hearts are  trump,  diamonds  are  trump,  clubs  are  trump  –  or  there  is  no trump.
When playing with trump, the order of the cards is different.

Name: Unfair: Secret Cabal Promo Cards
Description:
Sneak peek card - only valid until replaced by the final version.

     Available in the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast Kickstarter 2017.
     Available in the Unfair ABDW Expansion Kickstarter 2018.
     Planned to be available in the final expansion.


Shuffle these cards into the relevant deck(s) during setup and proceed as normal.
Add no more than one copy of any sneak peek or promo card.

Lockers & Coat Check (Upgrade - Guest Services)

Secret Base (Upgrade - Feature)
Active only when the attraction has a Lockers & Coat Check.
Park Step: You may use an action to draw three Event cards and choose one to keep.

Name: 51st State: Border Tiles Promo
Description: 4 double sided tiles that were part of the rewards for backing the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

Name: Bee Happy
Description:
The Basic Variant is for 2-year-old kids and is a memory game. 
Take 2 sets of “easy” tiles with red and yellow borders and add 4 random tiles with orange borders.
The youngest player starts, then play clockwise. The player takes a random tile from those face down and turns it up:
If you find a tile with just 1 figure, then search for the corresponding bee and “make it fly” taking it up. The turn passes to the next player.
If you find a tile showing all 5 bees... what a pity! Something scared them away and made them fly away! For this turn, you can’t try to make anyone fly.
When you complete an entire line of 6 tiles of the same type compared to those with just one image, you win, well done!

The Advanced Version is for 4-year-old kids. This is a competitive variant. 
The youngest player starts and then the others in a clockwise direction.
The active player receives the pile of tiles.
When everyone is ready, the current player says "Happy!" And turns the first tile of the stack quickly, resting it on the table face up so that it is clearly visible to all.
In games with 5 or 6 players, the active player simultaneously turns 2 tiles instead of 1.
All the players try to get to "fly" the bees indicated by tiles turned just taking them and raising them.
The player or players who remain without a bee...
....is forced to take a token web at random which must be kept the secret to their opponents until the end of the game.
Replace all the bee shapes on the board and discard the tiles used. The stack of tiles is then passed to the next player clockwise.
If there are not enough tiles to play a new round, shuffle those already used and discarded earlier.
When just 4 or less web tokens are left, the game ends.
All players turn over their spider web tokens: the player who has collected less spiders wins. In case of a tie, the player who has fewer spider web tokens and in case of further tie there are several winners.

Name: Near and Far: Secret Cabal Character Tiles
Description:
6 character tiles that were available as a reward for backing the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

The tiles are double sided with one side for Near and Far and the reverse side are characters that can played in either Above and Below or Islebound.

Name: Mini-Lotto
Description: The farm is normally a very busy place, but today the farm is very still as the farm inhabitants have managed to hide themselves very well. The first player who manages to cover all the motifs on their template board with matching lotto cards in Mini-Lotto wins.

Name: Mini-Memo
Description:
Where have both hedgehogs holed up? Where have the two fish disappeared to, and where is the pair of bears? To find out, concentration and a good memory are required in Mini-Memo. The player who can best remember the same pictures and therefore collect the most card pairs wins. A fun and colorful memory game.

How to play:

The player whose turn it is turns over  two memory cards, one after the other.

Do they show the same picture?
Excellent! Keep these two memory cards. You may then turn over two more cards.

Do they show different pictures?
What a pity! After everyone has seen the memory cards, turn them back over again.

The game ends when all the cards have been turned over and therefore all the pairs have been found. Stack your own memory cards. Whoever can build the highest card tower wins the game.

Name: Junior-5er-Pasch
Description:
Try your dice rolling luck in Junior-5er-Pasch, with the hope of either rolling as many of the same animals — or as many different animals — as possible. Whoever has the most Xs on their game sheet wins.

In more detail, on a turn you roll all of the dice, then you may reroll as many dice as you want up to two more times. After your third roll (or if you stop earlier), choose either one of the animals or the rainbow on your score sheet and cross it off. If you choose an animal, count how many animals of this type are on the dice, then X this many spaces on your score sheet; if you choose the rainbow, count how many different animals are on the dice, then X this many spaces. After seven rounds, the game ends.

Name: Control: The Fates of the World
Description:
You are a Prime Mage.  Unfortunately, so is your opponent.  Your opposing wills for the fate of the world will have to be resolved as they always are, where kings are pawns, on the board populated by the Souls of millions, in this broad land under the sun.

Control was designed with the idea that the best part about playing card games is playing cards.  You and your opponent each bring a 14 card deck to the table.  There are a total of eight possible colors of cards to make your deck from.  On your turns, you can play as many cards of two colors as you want, and once per game you may switch you hand and your deck.  This means that you could play all of your cards on your first turn (if you made a two color deck).

However, you would lose the game.  To win, you must cause your opponent to have zero cards in her deck.  This means that you have to strike the right balance in how many cards you play and when you play them.

The game has full color cards for print and play, printer friendly cards, and a Tabletop Simulator module.

Name: Esport Manager
Description:
Are you ready to create a team that will go down in the esports history? Become the best esports manager. Train your pupils, be in the spotlight, become the legend! But remember, you are not the only one who dream about it.

Esports Manager is the first esports game that at the very same time is a... board game! As a CEO of an esports team you will be getting more and more prestige and cash, which will allow you to hire the best players.

During a round players have to perform one of 4 actions:
1. Use an Action card. Player can perform action described on the card and pick certain amount of money and prestige.
2. Pick an Action card.
3. Buy a contract. However, player has to remember about having proper level of prestige.
4. Hire any amount of players.

The game is over while the last contract card is being bought.

The main goal of the game is hire the most valuable players. At the end of the game, players will get points for each of their contracted players as well as for coach cards and complementing a set of players of the same type. The person with the most points wins the game.

The game consists of:

30 Action cards
15 Player cards
4 Team cards
3 Coach cards
3 Special cards
16 money tokens
4 prestige tokens
Manual

Name: Flooping
Description: Become a buzzy pilot! Now it’s your turn to show off your aviator skills as a pilot in Flooping! Slide your BuzzPlane on your forefinger, pick a card to land on, close your eyes, and try to aim for the center of the card after the required aerobatics.

Name: Legendary Showdown: Presidential Edition
Description:
Based on the delightfully shady history of the United States presidents, this lighthearted game is designed to be enjoyed by experienced gamers and newcomers alike.  No background knowledge is needed to enjoy Legendary Showdown: Presidential Edition or plan your epic victory.

Each player controls a line of presidents. At the end of each round, the presidents at the front of each player's line will engage in battle. The victor continues battling, and the rest are removed.

To ensure your president's victory, there are numerous underhanded strategies you can employ.  You can give your presidents special bonuses that increase their strength, or you can give your opponents terrible bonuses to put them at a disadvantage.

You can also play cards to rearrange the order of your line, allowing a stronger president to compete, or rearrange the order of another player's line, forcing them to use a weak president.

Facedown cards can be employed to give your president a secret point bonus or ability, so you can never be sure which player is in the lead.

Action and instant cards allow you to mess with another player's strategy or swap your weaker presidents for stronger candidates.

The round continues until all players but one declare they are ready for battle by passing on their turns instead of playing cards. Players can gain a strategic advantage by delaying their actions until later in the round, but waiting too long might cause the battle to start before you've made your move.

Name: Labyrinth
Description: The players have to get one or two pawns from the black starting space through the maze to the yellow destination space. Movement is determined by a die. If the move of a meeple ends on a space with an arrow, the arrow determines the direction of movement for the next turn. Pawns are not allowed to turn around.

Name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Crawlers Expansion
Description:
This expansion for The Order of Vampire Hunters includes:

     5 Crawler miniatures
     1 Vampire ID card
     1 Rule sheet


Crawlers are an underground creature, bursting through the floorboards to make surprise attacks on the Hunters. 
This expansion includes everything you need to add Crawlers to your Hunts. The rules include three options for using the Crawlers to change the difficulty of the game, making it easier, harder or keeping it about the same.  You control how much danger the Hunters face!  
Crawlers can be used in any Order of Vampire Hunters game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle of Wits: Poisoner's Dilemma
Description:
Poisoner's Dilemma is a quick micro-game containing only four cards. The cards come in a custom printed sleeve that holds the whole game. 
The game is inspired by the scene in "The Princess Bride" where Vizzini and Westley face off in a Battle of Wits.
Westley serves two goblets of wine for the two to drink. But one goblet is tainted with poison! Which one??? 
“It ends when you decide and we drink 
and find out who is right and who is dead.” -Westley

The game consists of three cards: two wine cards and one poison card.

Entire Rules of Play

Each person starts with 3 life. 
The first person to zero life is dead.

Choose one person to be the Dealer and the other to be the Player.

Round Description:
1. The Dealer chooses one card to remove from 
the game for the round.
2. The Dealer serves one face-down card to the Player 
and one to themselves.
3. The Player chooses whether to drink the from card in front of themselves or from the card in front of the Dealer. 
The Dealer drinks from the other card.

a. If the poison card is in the game, whoever drinks it loses 1 life.
b. If the poison card is not in the game and the Player chooses their own card, no one loses a life.
c. If the poison card is not in the game and the Player chooses the card in front of the Dealer, it is a grave insult to the Dealer’s integrity, and the Dealer punches the Player. The Player loses a life.

Switch the role of Player and Dealer for the next round.

Name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Eten Expansion
Description:
This expansion for The Order of Vampire Hunters can be added to any Hunt and includes:

1 Highly Detailed Plastic Miniature.
1 Vampire ID Card.
10 Elder Influence Cards.
1 Rule Sheet.

Nete was a white witch, healing with herbs and bringing villagers together with love potions. Every formula was carefully recorded in her Book of Life. She lived just outside the hamlet, near the graveyard. She could easily harvest her ingredients in the fields and woodlands and at night, she secretly tended the graves, keeping them clean and beautiful. Especially that of her dead husband, who passed too young at 18.
The villagers were no fools. They accepted her broken-hearted obsession and knew her spells were just quackery. Back then, people took care of their own. Still, sometimes the herbs helped with toothache and someone had to tend the graves. It wasn’t all charity.

When the Night swept through, she was the first to be turned.
The boiling corruption coursing through her body has inverted Nete. Now a powerful Elder with the full power of Influence, Eten reads backwards from her Book of Blood as she repels and harms Hunters in her vicinity.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trickerion: Dahlgaard's Academy
Description:
The Great Dahlgaard’s spectacular contest for his legacy, the Trickerion Stone, has set Magoria off to a new Golden Age. Under the wise guidance of Dahlgaard’s Heir, the city has once again become a bustling, flourishing center of magic and illusion, with a new generation of aspiring young Magicians on the rise.

But now, without the power of the Trickerion Stone, the Great Dahlgaard is dying. In his last will, he entrusted his Heir with a grandiose task: he donated his old manor to be restored as the Academy of Magoria, a center of the education and perfection of magic tricks and illusion.

The Heir issues a public call for contributors among Magoria’s aspiring Magicians: the Academy shall be restored as a common effort, but the most successful contributor’s name will be remembered forever as the Patron of Magoria.

Dahlgaard’s Academy expands the magical world and gameplay of Trickerion with a slew of exciting new features:

A new Location - the Academy: Join the common effort to renovate the Academy! Each Renovation action awards Fame proportionately to the Coins spent on it, and opens up new Classrooms and Practice Rooms, where Academy markers can be placed. Academy markers in Practice Rooms give the performed Tricks increased Yield or other special placement abilities, while the Tricks taught in the Classrooms will be passed on to the new generations - they can no longer be performed, but grant a useful passive yield each turn. The Academy is also a place to train your Protegé, a new member of your team.

A new Specialist - the Protegé: Each Magician will now start with the Protegé, a new type of specialist. The Protegé is more than just a worker - they will accompany your Magician on their path to greatness, constantly developing in the process. By Visiting the Academy, Protegés can acquire powerful new abilities that also increase their Action Points - and their salary as well! A fully developed Protegé will have 3 Actions points, just like the Magician, with some very powerful abilities to boot!

A new quartet of Magicians: Magoria’s new Golden Age attracts aspiring young Magicians from all over the world, eager to prove themselves, and maybe one day become the Patron of Magoria. Each school of illusion (Mechanical, Optical, Escape, Spiritual) will receive a new, charismatic Magician, with their own personal backstory, powerful special ability.

Solo Mode: Dalhgaard's Heir: This expansion will also feature a solo mode, with an elaborate story setting. Take a journey to a possible future of Magoria, where Dahlgaard’s Heir couldn’t resist the immense power of the Trickerion Stone, and dabbing into the supernatural has eclipsed their sanity. Magoria’s Golden Age is over - now the Heir controls it with an iron grip, and it falls to you to prove your superiority and remove him from power the only way the city knows - through magic and illusion. This solo mode features Dahlgaard’s Heir as a fully automated, intricate opponent with variable difficulty levels - a worthy foe to even the most seasoned Trickerion veterans!

Name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Gaming
Description:
Do you know where the secret lives can be found and which combo that does the most damage? Do you think that the best parties are LAN and that easter eggs should be digital? Here is the quiz for all of us whose parent thought we should have spent more time in the fresh air.

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.

Name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Gugadeth and the Beast Expansion
Description:
This expansion for The Order of Vampire Hunters includes:

1 Highly Detailed Plastic Miniature, Gugadeth and the Beast.
2 Vampire ID Cards.
10 Elder Influence Cards.
1 Rule Sheet.

Both Gugadeth and the Beast are Elder Vampires. They have their own Elder Influence Cards, and can be added to any Hunt that includes an Elder Vampire.

GUGADETH AND THE BEAST

Gareth was a kennel master living on a small country estate. When the Night swept through, he was feeding the hounds, making sure the pack leader, Dex, did not take too much more than his fair share. The Vampires sensed the vicious nature of the hunting dogs, so it was the pack that the Vampires turned, while the workers and family were simply drained as food. But the kennel master’s de¬votion to his pack gave him the strength to cling to this world, although the corruption in his dying body meant he was no longer truly capable of that emotion.
Caring for the pack of Guardians was now his new role in the clan and soon the pack ran at the vanguard of the Vampire raiding parties. With so much blood spilt, his power grew, as did the Guardian’s alpha, who was seemingly immune to the harm that caused attrition to the pack. What was devotion was now an unholy bond, passing power in both directions.

Slowly the pack began to spend more time hunting and sleeping alone. Despite their ag¬gression, Guardians fell in battle, and eventu¬ally it was just the pair that was left. No-one from the clan was there to chastise the kennel master for his slack work, but then, he was no mere minion anymore and would not take criticism easily.

No, Gareth and Dex had grown to be the Elders Gugadeth and the Beast, forever bound as a pack of two.

—description from the publisher

Name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Shadowvale
Description:
Darkness looms upon the Kingdom of Valeria. Werewolves, Vampires, and other shadowy creatures reach out in the night to tear apart your people. But never fear, new Citizens have joined the fray - some specializing in taking out these dark creatures!

Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Shadowvale brings in a whole new set of Citizens, Monsters, Domains, and Dukes that you can play stand-alone using components from the base game, or mix with card stacks from the base game for all new experiences.

Name: Convoys in Flames/Cruisers in Flames
Description:
CoiF/CliF provides you with both Convoys in Flames and Cruisers in Flames. It includes 800 counters (CS 36, 2 x CS 37 & CS 38), rules and charts.

Note: CoiF/CliF requires World in Flames in order to be played.

(from ADG's website)

Name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Grelrok Expansion
Description:
Grelrok is a Vampire Elder that can be used with the Order of Vampire Hunters game in any standalone Hunt or campaign. This expansion includes:

1 highly detailed plastic miniature
1 Vampire ID card
A rulesheet

The sharp protruding bones, thick hide and bulging muscles send a clear message, Grelrok is here to fight. Grelrok is a misshapen beast that uses its whole body as a weapon. It does not matter if its prey remains in one piece, what matters is that it’s dead.

—description from the publisher

Name: Objective: Schmidt
Description:
Objective Schmidt depicts the hard fought battles that occurred in early November, 1944 in the Hurtgen Forest by the U.S. 28th Infantry Division for the small towns of Schmidt/Kommerscheidt and Vossenack.

Objective: Schmidt includes the following:
·17 action packed scenarios in full-color print, including a campaign game (CG) covering the battle for Kommerscheidt over 7 CG dates
·576 full color, die cut 1/2" counters
·88 full color, die cut 5/8" counters
·Two 22"x 34" HASL map sheets which combine to represent the historical situation of the town of Vossenack
·Four 22"x 34" HASL map sheets with 1" hexgrids which combine to represent the historical situation of the towns of Schmidt and Kommerscheidt
·An article covering "Slopes in ASL"
·Rules pages describing Vehicles/Ordnance notes, Historical Battle Rules (HBR), map terrain and campaign game rules
·A divider card for quick reference of HBRs during scenario and CG play

Ownership of the following Hasbro/MMP ASL products are required to play all of the included scenarios: Beyond Valor©, Yanks©
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Witches' Brew
Description:
There is a fire under the cauldron and magic in the air!
In this children's game the players can act, guess and cast spells. Use your magic wand to determine who gets to act, and pull an acting disc straight out of the bubbling cauldron! Then the other players get to guess what you have turned into! The acting player and the one who guessed your character right get a scoring disc each, and the first player to have collected five scoring discs wins the game!

Name: Taiko
Description:
A strategic table-top card game set in Japan during the age of samurai.

Taiko was designed in Pittsburgh with the goal of creating a fast-to-learn game that engaged the attention of both casual (social) and strategic players.  The number of players can be extended from a minimum of 2 seamlessly to an unlimited number of players (Present record is a single circle of 14 players).  Taiko has a unique starting setup since each player begins with an identical army (selected from the available cards), and there is no random shuffling or dealing anytime during the game.

Gameplay: Each player begins with a castle to defend, and 7 warrior cards.  Simultaneously, each player put facedown a card from their hand on their left and a card on their right which will attack that neighbor.  Cards are resolved based on their value (higher wins) or by special abilities.  After resolving, all cards are traded.  The game continues until all castles are defeated except for the last castle standing: the round champion.

—description from the designer

Name: Grimslingers: Retro Card Pack
Description:
Contains six environments and pixel characters using art borrowed from an earlier, unreleased version of the game. The environment cards can be drawn before a duel starts to add a unique mechanic to your duels. Can be used with Grimslingers and Grimslingers: Duels.

—description from the publisher

Name: Grimslingers: Collector's Card Pack
Description:
Contains two exclusive characters cards, Icarus the Iron Witch and Lord Briar, as well as three sets of light and dark element cards. The light and dark elements will add more variety and strategies to your duels. Can be used with Grimslingers and Grimslingers: Duels.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kicking Class
Description:
Maybe you thought you were done with high school forever, or maybe you have been dreaming of the day you would finally start. Kicking Class brings an enticingly comical twist to high school. Players take on the role of students going through a whirlwind of hilariously relatable high school faux pas. In the game, you will race against your fellow students to come out on top and claim a full-ride scholarship to the university of your dreams.

Unlike your typical scholarships, which judge you based on boring things like your GPA or school contributions, the K.A. scholarship has developed its own unique ranking system. To claim this scholarship, you will need to pass classes, spread rumors, throw parties, and do whatever it takes to get the upper hand over your fellow students.

Whether you strive for popularity or bury your face behind textbooks, the options are endless. Now get ready to kick some class!

OVERVIEW

The game takes place over the 4 years of high school. Each year there are 3 trimesters, in which you will be taking classes. To pass a class, you will roll skill dice and see if you meet the requirements. If you pass, you keep the card and gain the reward. If you fail, you must draw from the dreaded failure deck!

You will earn scholarship points (SP) for passing classes, being popular, and taking the ACT. At the end of the game, whoever has the most scholarship points wins!

Name: The World Council: Disaster
Description: Disaster Expansion will include some random events. Councilors need to face them together in order to make the world a better place and save their country from destruction!

Name: Candygrams
Description:
Each player starts with 25 letter tiles and builds their own color-coded crossword. Players begin by each building a “base word” that uses all three colors (pink, yellow, and blue). In each following round, after any one player rolls the dice for a “color combo,” every player connects one new word to their own crossword, matching the color combo rolled. Match the color combo by using any combination of both colors rolled — and only those colors — to form your entire new word. The game continues in rounds until the first player to use all their letters in their crossword (and then quickly grab both dice) is the winner.

There are two different ways to play: “Standard” and “Express.” Standard has a relaxed pace of play, while Express is a fast-paced word race.

Name: Vengeance: Kickstarter Exclusives
Description:
This is a bundle containing several Kickstarter-exclusive stretch goals for Vengeance.

It contains:
4 Item Upgrades
4 Ability Upgrades
Runa Bolt Hero Board, Miniature, 9 Montage cards and Runa Bolt's Solo Mission card.

Name: Zombies all around us
Description:
“Zombies all around us” is a CO-OP 1 or 2 player turn based card game using grid movement, dice rolls and a tower defense mechanic.  The game is made up of only 9 cards and 18d6 and has a game time of 20 to 30 minutes.

The game takes place in either a 4/6 room house or 4/6 room tavern.  The players will take turns trying to stay alive through the night for either 18 or 24 turns; represented as hours.

Zombies have overrun the city and the players have found safety in an abandoned house/tavern.  As the zombies attack, the player must try to build makeshift weapons to destroy the zombies attacking the access points "doors/windows".  The players can also search to try and find a real weapon "pistol/shotgun" to destroy even more zombies at a time.

Each turn the zombies will randomly attack a window or door at any of the 4/6 rooms, with sometimes 2 zombies attacking at once.  When the zombies reach a max of 6 zombies at a door/window and are not blocked by reinforcing the barricades, they break into the house/tavern and takeover the room.  If 2 or more rooms are lost to the zombies the game ends.  If either player dies before the 18/24 turns are up, the games ends.

Each time a zombie is destroyed they are worth 1 point and 5 points for a super zombie. If the players lose any health they subtract 1 point per health lost.  If a real weapon is found and used a one-time -10 point deduction is made to the total points.  The players are not only trying to survive the night but also reach the highest zombie hit count possible.

Name: Circuit Breaker
Description:
Circuit Breaker is a casual strategy game that can be played solo or with up to two other friends. All players attempt to successfully re-wire their own houses in time for a hastily scheduled house party, and they score points by connecting a variety of quirky electrical doodads to their home circuits. Resource management and a crafty rodent will be put to use in a fun and cheeky race to be the most "happening" place on the block.

—description from the publisher

Name: Qyps
Description: Qyps is a connection game played with a hand of domino-like pieces on a triangular board. Like it predecessors, Wyps and The Game of Y, the player who connects all three sides of the board wins. Also like Wyps, opponent pieces can be converted. Qyps differs in that connections are built with chains of pieces sharing the same values.

Name: The Song of Salt
Description:
A mysterious real history 
A civilized opera 2000 years ago 
A magical industrial history 
A fascinating history of struggle   
A group of people with special positions who are emerging, flourishing and finally extinct in the vast ocean of history 
- The Song of Salt

In distant oriental continent, there is a position to maintain the stability of the country, i.e. salt administrator. 
What is salt administrator? 
Long time ago, salt played an important role in the social economy. In that era and background, salt administrator, as the highest leader in the salt production process, was formally appointed by the court of Northern Song Dynasty, ranking sixth in political circle and in charge of a salt field.  
On the other hand, the salt manufacturing is always dependent on fate from ancient times to date. Regardless of raw material collection or obtaining salt by drying bittern, they all are dependent on the generous gifts of nature. Now, as the new salt administrators appointed by the court, you have to complete the salt manufacturing task assigned by the court in the shortest possible time. You will face challenges from both competitors and nature, every choice you made may change the fate of the salt field. You will experience this piece of magical history in this game and master this ancient technology, salt manufacturing.

The most important thing is that you will meet constant new challenges, and you should maintain a calm judgment on using which way for salt manufacturing. After hard works, there will be a mysterious final test. 
Today, you are about to take office. In the next years of cooking bittern from the sea, the new salt administrators, please bring yourselves back to the ancient ages, and please achieve your ideal with fair decisions and rational minds, so as taste the difficulty in the ancient salt manufacturing process.

—description from the publisher

Name: Space Princess
Description:
Space Princess is a two-player retro sci-fi strategy game that fits in your pocket.  Test your wits against a friend as the Space Princess or the Dark Zealot, each with their own unique abilities and powers.  Beautifully illustrated by Rachel Kozy and graphic design by Ian Moss, Space Princess is an homage to our favorite space princess, the late Carrie Fisher. Proceeds from Space Princess are donated to the International Bipolar Foundation, a cause supported by Ms. Fisher and dear to us!

—description from the publisher

Name: Revolt
Description:
Revolt is a two-player space combat game set in the inner solar system; the map's outer edge is the orbit of Jupiter. One player represents a solar system government and the other player a rebellion against it.

Each side has a fleet of ships and a number of bases. Ship counters can represent any number of ships so each player knows where the other has forces but not how strong they are. The ships use vector movement; they can accelerate or decelerate a certain amount each turn and also change heading a certain amount (in 5-degree increments); their movement vectors are drawn on the board.

Combat is deterministic; the attacker's strength is divided by the distance between the attacker and defender to determine the number of strength points lost.

The sun's gravitational effects are taken into account for ship movement, but those of the planets are not. The planets and space stations move along their orbits during the game.

The objective of the government player is to eliminate all rebel ships and bases; the rebel player wins if they can avoid this for 30 turns.

The basic rules for the game were published in four issues of International Wargamer beginning with the December 1970 issue. The game was also available from the designers; this version included additional tournament rules and presumably also contained the map and counters, as they did not appear in the magazine.

Name: Fang den Wurm
Description:
Fang den Wurm, which has also been released as Early Bird and Sjef Specht en Willie Worm, is a fast dexterity game. Willie the worm is hiding in a tree, and Sjef the woodpecker is trying to release him to grab a bite to eat.

The tree is divided in three colors. On your turn, you must spin the wheel or roll the die (depending on which edition of the game you have). The results: yellow, blue, green, choose a color, spin two additional times, or skip your turn.

You rotate the tree to match the correct color, aim, and release Sjef. He pricks holes until Willie is released and jumps out of the tree after which the game ends. Whoever makes the worm jump wins!

Name: 101 Dalmatians Spoons Card Game
Description:
A kid-friendly version of the classic "Spoons" party game.

Plastic "bones" are laid in the center of the table, equivalent to one less than the number of players. Each player has a hand of 4 cards; first player draws a new card and discards directly to the next player, who must take that card and discard to the next, etc. When the final player has drawn, s/he discards to a discard deck, and the beginning player draws a new card from the draw deck. As soon as one player has acquired a full 4-of-a-kind set, they discard and then claim a bone from the table, which triggers a mad dash on the part of the other players to grab the remaining bones. The slowest to claim a bone is eliminated from the game each round, leaving a single winning player.

This version differs from regular Spoons because that one requires players to simultaneously transfer cards to the left while accepting cards from the right, while this version has one player drawing then discarding at a time, and progressing around the table, one player at a time. Furthermore, the rules about being a "pig" and then a "hog" are nowhere in the Disney version,

Name: 20 Clues: World Geography
Description:
20 Question style cards based on world geography, including a window-board with the numbers 1-20, to keep track of guesses. Reader chooses a random card, reads the category ("I am a land region," for example), and players take turns choosing a number. Reader reads the clue corresponding to that number (in this example, clue number 13 is: "The name the Indians gave me means "'Ground Afire'"), and that player takes a single guess at the answer. If wrong, play progresses to next player (if multiple players). If correct, the player wins points equal to 20-the number of clues required to guess the answer. Play continues until one player or team reaches 50, or some other predetermined point total. Alternatively, a set number of cards or a time limit can be set, and highest points wins.

Target areas range from very obvious (Pacific Ocean) to slightly obscure (Denali National Park).

Name: Infernal Contraption: Zombiphage Cannon Promo Card
Description:
The back of the card specifically says "Infernal Contraption 2nd Edition"

Card text:
"Your opponent puts the top card of the scrap pile into his hand and puts two cards from his hand on top of his parts pile."

Was packaged inside Zombies Keep Out

Name: Herding Cats (with Goblins)
Description:
Izzy Ickybit, your venerable Goblin Matriarch, is rather fond of her collection of singing/yowling cats. Each morning, these scraggly felines greet the day with a cacophonic symphony of hisses and wails as their cages sway and clink in the breeze.

On boring afternoons, Izzy releases her cats into a den of embittered Owlbedillos, along with several of her most irritating subjects (a.k.a., you). To gain back her favour, you'll have to finagle and fight your way through to catch as many cats as you can before your rivals nab them all. This may sound easy, but then again, you're herding cats... with Goblins...

Herding Cats (with Goblins) is a quick and chaotic arena based card game designed  for Concrete Canoes' and The Game Crafters' "Hook box challenge".

Pushing the limits of what you can do with a limited number of components, this game packs a huge amount of fun into a pocket-sized box.

Using a free-form movement mechanic (measured with your handy-dandy playing card), you'll employ cunning (and often morally questionable) tactics in order to collect as many points worth of cats as you can, while avoiding the obstacles that your rivals throw your way. First player to have 4 points-worth of cats at the start of their turn wins!

Herding Cats is designed for 2-4 players, and takes 10-20 minutes to play, making it perfect for the start of your next games night, or for while you're waiting for that one person who never rocks up on time.

—description from the publisher

Name: WimbleDOOM: Game, Set, MASSACRE!
Description:
WimbleDOOM - Game, Set, MASSACRE! is a fantasy tennis dice & card game set in the world of Iotilas where races from different continent come together yearly to compete for a deadly & gruesome tennis match. This game is inspired by the tennis rules in our world and a simplified scoring system to keep the game tight & exciting.

This game is designed to visualize the weird fantasy world we have in our mind where fantasy races such as Orcs, Elves & other fascinating races competing in a dangerous Tennis match where brutality meet sportsmanship.

Each race will need more than Brute Force, Magic, Blessing & Luck to win the glory of the tennis champion and bring pride to their race.

Now that you have resolved all the 3 phases, you will begin a new round starting with the service phase again.

The game will end once the a player won 4 points.

Name: Unfair Expansion: Alien B-movie Dinosaur Western
Description:
Build the city's greatest theme park, whatever it takes, with more themes now available for your park with Unfair Expansion: Alien B-movie Dinosaur Western, with these themes being mixable with old favorites and with each other. The new themes are:


    Alien: Build superior alien technology in your park, and pay for it with an entirely new currency provided by our beloved overlords. Ignore the spate of unexplained disappearances — it's nothing.
    B-movie: Mash up themes and re-use their best parts to make the most awesome awful movies in town. Filming in panorama-vision is now available for extra value.
    Dinosaur : Discover a mysterious valley filled with living dinosaurs that offers exciting new attractions...for a park owner willing to take the risk.
    Western: Make a stand, build a better life for yourself, strike it rich, and get robbed by outlaws in the wild west.


You can also tailor the game to suit your preferred play style with a range of new game changer cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jewels: Minatore
Description:
A new promo card for Jewels which was originally given out at Lucca Convention

Text:
Discard 2 cards and choose any gem card from the discard pile, adding it to your hand.

Name: Era of Voyage: the DICE
Description:
Era of Voyage: the DICE is a dice game based on age of exploration. It is not an expansion of Era of Voyage, but a standalone game.

Purpose of the game 
The player is a merchant in a port city. The goal is to be a successful merchant who has greater influence than any other merchants.

Game Outline
Select an investment destination map by randomly selecting 7 cards from multiple trade cards and 1 card from the base card.
Players will roll two dice when they turn their turn. Select "income" or "investment" from the outgoing eyes and execute it. "Revenue" can earn "additional income" from the trade route card that invested as "basic income" corresponding to the outcome. "Investment" obtains the right of "additional income" and "victory point" by investing in the trade route card corresponding to the outcome.
If you do not like the outcome of the dice, you can also reorder by paying the prescribed money.
"Luck" is necessary because this is a dice game in this work, but "thinking" is also necessary how to use dice. Let's aim for victory by combining "luck" and "thinking" well!

Contents
· Card: 24 sheets
· Chips: 150 sheets
· Dice: 2 pieces
· Instructions: 1

Name: Mezame No Sora
Description:
Urgent recruitment! Now that efficient space development has become possible, Japan has decided to support companies participating in space development. Please contact the ministry office for the company you want.

You are the president of a space development company. Thousands of years after humans began to fly, humans finally made their way into space. Space development has accelerated at a stretch by creating stars in outer space and recovering resources from them, and it is now a major business of the entire industry. Stay on top of this big wave, outsmart your rivals, and win lots of resources!

Mezame No Sora (ç›®è¦šã‚ã®å®‡å®™) is a set collection game. Each turn, you play three out of four cards to move or turn your rocket, and pick up a card from the color of the planet you end up on (if the planet is still unexplored). At the start of your turn you discard down to four cards into your personal score pile. If you push someone out of the universe map, you get to steal cards from their score pile.
At the end of the game, each card is worth 1 point, with 1, 2 or 3 bonus points for the majority in the three available colors.

In this game, you have five cards in your hand, each of which corresponds to a specific movement of the rocket (for example, two squares forward). You are required to select the most suitable action from the limited options and operate your own rocket. At the end of each turn, each player's position becomes a star and acquires resources. The rocket will become more and more difficult to move because it will be an "out zone" where you will be penalized if you enter.

You can even crash your opponent by pushing them out of the field or to a position with a star! By doing so, you can steal resources from the opponent and get points, so it is often advantageous.

Rules Summary:

Use your hand to move the rockets in order. Since the number of cards you can use is small, let's move systematically. On the contrary, it is also possible to advance the game in an advantageous way by predicting the opponent's hand and action.

At the end of the turn, explore the planet and win cards. This will be a means of transporting rockets as a hand. The effect obtained for each color of the reclamation area is fixed. Be aware of the cards you want and collect them.

It is an out zone where you cannot enter the planets and the outside of the cultivated planet. Let alone self-destruction, you need to be careful not to be dropped by the other party. If you drop your opponent, you can steal a lot of cards from your opponent, so let's aim aggressively.

The person with the most cards in the end wins! Bonus points will be given to the player with the highest number of cards for each color, so it may be the secret of victory not to give up until the end.

Name: Agentenjagd
Description: In Agentenjagd, players are agents who must try to find the spy hiding in one of the cities on the board. At the beginning of the game, only the app knows where the spy is. Using various means of transportation, the agents search for the spy all over the world. By using action cards, the agents get valuable tips from the app that only they know.

Name: Schlaraffen Affen
Description:
Many juicy fruits await on the trees in Schlaraffen Affen, especially the coconuts on the palm tree in the middle of the game board. To reach the coconuts, the monkeys must move from fruit to fruit through the forest, possibly stealing from one another as well. Travel on the back of another monkey, and you'll move even faster.

Who can first collect a coconut of their own color from the palm tree and win the game?

Name: Kill Merlin!
Description:
Recommended by American Mensa - 2023 Mensa Mind Games

Merlin is the most powerful wizard in the land, and he has cornered the market on all mana and magical ingredients. His impetuous and undpredictable nature has made life for an aspiring magic user a challenge. As long as Merlin lives, you and your fellow wizards must hide in the shadows and follow his every whim. You know that there is only one way to end his megalomaniacal reign.

You must kill him.

Use your wits, magical ingredients, and the very elements of nature to assemble a mystical spell that can bring Merlin down. However, as you pursue your dreams of power, so too do the other magical beings of the realm. And the only thing more dangerous than a crafty old wizard is an ambitious young one. Actually, all wizards are terrifying, so be careful.

Buy ingredients, learn spells, cast spells to thwart your opponents, and be the first to defeat Merlin so that all may revere your glory!

—description from the publisher

Name: DOG Kids
Description:
In Kids DOG, players use cards in their hand to move their three dogs from their start space to home. On a player's turn, they play one of the three cards in their hand, then move one of their three dogs according to what's on the card played:


    A colored paw moves your dog to the next space of that color.
    Two colored paws moves you to the second space of that color.
    A "dog swap" card lets you exchange places between one of your dogs and an opponent's dog, as long as they're not at home or in a protective kennel.
    A double-color card lets you move to the next space of either color.
    A kennel card moves you to the next empty kennel on the board.


Land on an opponent's dog with one of your own, and they have to start from the beginning once again. If you'd land on one of your own dogs, you can instead jump it and move to the next space of this color.

The first player to get all three dogs home wins!

Name: Arnold Takes Command: The Battle of Bemis Heights
Description:
Arnold Takes Command is a new kind of card-driven wargame for two players, ages 12 to 99. Unlike most of its siblings, in this game movement plays an insignificant role. Additionally, prior experience with traditional wargames isn’t required. ATC isn’t a dice-rolling slugfest or a “take that” affair. Here, it’s all about the card play: what to play, when to play it, what to discard, what to track, etc.

The game has two distinct phases, just like the actual battle. Players use action cards of various types to attack, defend, gain initiative, maneuver, emulate morale, take cover, use “fog of war” to their advantage, and so forth. Single “duds” are discarded, but pairs have a useful purpose.

A preponderance of “split” action cards ensures a nice variance from game to game. Components include 70+ cards and two maps.

—description from the designer

Name: Dead Men Tell No Tales: The Kraken Expansion
Description:
At first, all I could feel was vibrations in my feet, then, a low rumble that seemed to shake the entire ship. It grew louder until it was almost deafening. The ship lurched to one side, and I instinctively reached for the nearest post — despite the flames that crawled up it. There was a screeching sound that seemed to come from everywhere… And then I was on my back. The wood splintered as it crashed around me. The room flooded with water. Then I saw it: a tentacle the size of a ship’s mast crashed through the room, obliterating everything in sight. But I was ready for this! I knew the Kraken was in these waters. So I took up my axe and pushed my way toward the treasure…

When playing with The Kraken, the gameplay remains the same as Dead Men Tell No Tales, with the following exceptions: A new threat has emerged from the sea! In order to win the game, in addition to getting the treasure and your pirates off the ship, you must ALSO kill the Kraken. If the Kraken destroys the ship or pulls it underwater, you lose the game.

Name: Comic Turns
Description:
Comic Turns is a comics storytelling game system – a deck of cards where each has a comic panel all carefully designed so that they can be arranged in any order to make countless new comic strips and infinite stories.

The deck comes with optional rules for three games included; ways to play competitively, collaboratively, and just to explore the storytelling possibilities, but user-created rules and ways to play are highly encouraged!

In the included rules, gameplay involves adding or replacing cards from a hand or pool to create narratives. The goal is always to create the best, most unique, interesting or fun stories. In a competitive version of the game, players have to fill in the middle of a story between a start and end card with cards from their hand. They take it in turns to reveal and tell their stories, and then vote for a winner. Voting is done by simultaneous pointing at the person whose comic strip you liked the best. In the collaborative versions, the emphasis is on building stories as a group, either by adding panels, or swapping panels out for new ones.

Comic Turns is also a tool for learning about comics, building stories, inspiring creative writing and sparking the imagination.

Name: Ernst von Mansfeld
Description:
We write the year 1623 and there is war in the German lands. Even from distance, you can hear the steady beating of the drums. The recruiters with their sounding coins come to town and try to recruit new soldiers for the mercenary armies, which are being excavated everywhere. You hope the recruiters will be successful because they work on your behalf.

Ernst von Mansfeld is a tactical dice game for 2 to 4 players and is divided into the 2 consecutive phases recruiting and conquering. 
In the recruitment, the players try to win as many and powerful soldiers as possible for their mercenary army. This requires tactics and clever consideration of the risk, as the player who dares to reach the required dice value with fewer dice than his competitors may try his luck first.
In the second phase, the players have to compete with their deployed armies against each other to conquer different valuable provinces. The smart use of your own troops as well as the correct anticipation of the tactics of the opponents are necessary to secure the provinces and to enter history as the most successful mercenary general.

Name: Xia: Missions and Powers
Description:
Xia: Missions and Powers is a mini-expansion for Xia: Legends of a Drift System. It includes 54 cards:

21 new ship powers, one for each existing player ship, offering players a choice each time they acquire a ship. The new powers are balanced with the existing powers, but offer greater reliability and can be used multiple times per turn.

32 new missions, with 8 missions of 4 new types: Transport, Assist, Counterfeit, and BOOM! These missions can be started more easily than most other existing missions, since they require only a sector type (e.g. Ice Asteroid) instead of a specific sector. Furthermore, these missions end at players, making them more interactive and easier to complete in the early game, when missions are often difficult.

There is also one rules/credits card that is included.

Overall, this mini-expansion offers Xia players many new permutations for ship powers, and more interactive missions.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Xia: Legends of a Drift System

Name: Book of Mormon: Mania
Description:
This is a Book of Mormon themed game of Nerts. Here is the description from the back of the game:
"This fast-paced game combines the concentration of Solitaire with the quickness of Speed - and throws in a Book of Mormon twist. Each player is given one of the decks of 48 cards representing the Nephites, Lamanites, Jaredites, or Mulekites. Players try to be first to rid themselves of their pride piles by building prosperity piles in the middle of the table. The fun rises to a feverish pitch as everyone begins flipping and placing cards at the same time!
The breathless action comes to a screeching halt when the first 'pride-less" person yells out whatever favorite Book of Mormon name was chosen at the beginning of the hand - if they can remember it!"

Name: Milestone Mayhem
Description:
Will Your Project Suck or Succeed?

In the game, you are the project lead on a front-end web app development project for a well known enterprise software and services company. Your goal is to complete your milestone before your rival project lead completes theirs.

To complete a milestone you turn over a card and earn points towards your milestone. Seems simple right? Well, just like in real life, there’s a lot of mayhem laying in wait to throw your project into chaos.

Name: Consequence
Description:
In Consequence, players take turns to place tiles strategically on the grid face down with the goal to get its own tiles in intersecting rows and the other tiles spread out.

You score by pairs of your own symbol, regardless of the color of the tile.

The blue player scores with pairs of moons and the red player score with pairs of suns. Rows, columns and diagonals of symbols could cross, and the tile that is in the joint of counts as part of both when scoring, horizontally, vertically and diagonally at the same time.

—description from the publisher

Gameplay: At the start of the game, players hide their discs from the other players eyes. Keep the discs hidden throughout the game.

The players will take turns placing one disc on the grid upside down, goal is to get your own pieces in a row (or rows) and the other player's discs spread out.

At your turn: Place one disc on an empty square the board OR move one disc (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) on the board to an adjacent empty square OR place and push a row of discs one square aside (making the disc already on the board slide one square in chosen direction (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). Discs that fall out of the grid because of this push is picked up by the pushing player regardless of the color of the disc. Discs picked up may be seen and used by that player, place it among the concealed discs or in your palm.

To make the push discs move, there have to be an empty square where to place the pushing disc at start of the pushing. You could not start off grid pushing a row or column only from an empty spot within the grid.

Final scoring: As all discs is placed on the board, you flip them over and score points. You score points both horizontally, vertically and diagonally, you score your own symbol discs and disregard blank discs.Note that you score regardless of color of the disc as long as it got your symbol.

Rows of symbols could cross, and the disc that is in the joint of both rows counts as part of both rows when scoring (both horizontally, vertically and diagonally).

One isolated disc = 0 points
Two in a row = 2 points
Three in a row = 3 points
Four in a row = 4 points

Combinations of above 2-12 points

—description from the designer

Name: What Do You Meme?: Fresh Memes Expansion Pack #1
Description:
Fresh Memes Expansion Pack #1 includes 115 Cards (90 caption cards & 25 photo cards)

Add the cards to their respective decks and play as normal.

Name: Domino Zootiere
Description:
Domino Zootiere is a cute arranging fun for 2-3 children ages 2 years and older. Who will get rid of all their domino cards first?

How to play:

Do you have a domino card with one of the two animals?

Yes? – Excellent! Then place the domino card so that the animals that are the same are next to each other.
No? – Too bad! You can't place a domino card; take one domino card from the stack and place it face-up in front of you. If the new domino card matches a picture on the table then you may immediately place it.

End of the game
If players can no longer place any cards and there are no more face-down cards, then the game is over.  If a player successfully places all their domino cards, they win the game

Name: Domino Baustelle
Description:
Domino Baustelle is a cute arranging fun for 2-3 children ages 2 years and older. Who will get rid of all their domino cards first?

How to play:

Do you have a domino card with one of the two building site pictures? 
Yes? – Excellent! Then place the domino card so that the pictures that are the same are next to each other.
No? – Too bad! You can't place a domino; take one domino card from the stack and place it face-up in front of you. If the new domino card matches a picture on the table then you may immediately place it.

End of the game    
If players can no longer place any cards and there are no more face-down cards, then the game is over. If a player successfully places all of their domino cards, they win the game!

Name: Memo Bauernhof
Description:
Memo Bauernhof provides entertaining memory fun for 2-4 children from 2 years. Who can remember the positions of the barnyard pictures and collect the most pairs?

How to play:

Did you turn over two of the same picture? Excellent! You can take the pair and keep it.  
    
Did you turn over two different pictures? Too bad, but it's OK!   Once everyone else has has a chance to see  the barnyard cards you can turn them back over again.

End of the game    
Have all the pairs been collected? Then all children place their barnyard cards next to each other: The player with the longest row of cards wins the game.

Name: Memo Fahrzeuge
Description:
Memo Fahrzeuge provides entertaining memory fun for 2-4 children ages 2 years and older. Who can remember the positions of the vehicles and collect the most pairs?

How to play:

Did you turn over two of the same vehicle? Excellent! You can take the pair and keep it.  
    
Did you turn over two different vehicles? Too bad, but it's OK! Once everyone has the opportunity to see the vehicle cards you can turn them back over again.

End of the game
Have all the pairs been collected? Then all children place their vehicle cards next to each other: The player with the longest vehicle fleet wins the game.

Name: Lotto Fahrzeuge
Description:
Lotto Fahrzeuge is a fun matching game for 2-4 children from 2 years. Who will be the first to fill their own base card with the right vehicles?

How to play:

Children play in a clockwise direction, taking turns. The youngest child begins and turns over a vehicle card. Everyone compares this vehicle card with their own base card. The player who finds the vehicle on their base card can take the vehicle card and place it face-up on their base card.

End of the game
The first player to place all three vehicle cards on their own base card wins the game!

Name: Lotto Feenland
Description:
Lotto Feenland is a fun matching game for 2-4 children from 2 years. Who will be the first to fill their own base card with the matching fairyland friends?

How to play:

Children play in a clockwise direction, taking turns. The youngest child begins and turns over a fairy card. Everyone compares this fairy card with their own base card. The player who finds the fairy on their base card can take the fairy card and place it face-up on their base card.

End of the game
The first player to place all three fairy cards on their own base card wins the game!

Name: Cultists of Cthulhu: Art Gallery
Description: There is a gallery showing at Miskatonic University, and the campus is covered in pieces of art. Some are beautiful, while some are horrifying, but all will leave an impression. This contains a new type of card, the Work of Art, which are spread around the map. Examining them can grant you bonuses, or scare you out of your wits, depending on how discerning your taste is. Contains 25 Art cards, 1 Cultist Card (Pickman's Model). A subset of art cards are placed face down in rooms on the map, and when examined, are revealed, and have an effect on everyone in that tile, and remain for the duration of the game.

Name: Cultists of Cthulhu: Music Recital
Description: Old folks may disapprove of it, but college kids know that there' s just something magical about that Jazz. Includes a deck of 13 Music Cards and rules for how to use them. Music is an optional rule: play the 15 minute soundtrack, which functions as a timer. Every 15 minutes a loud, easily noticable bell will prompt you to draw a new card from the Music Deck. Music cards can be good or bad for the Academics, and are resolved by whoever the current player is.

Name: Cultists of Cthulhu: Tomes and Spells
Description: There wouldn't be much point in having this amazing library if nobody ever read anything in it, right? Includes Forbidden Book Cards which are hazardous to read at best, and at worst, outright maddening to try to understand.
