If you do understand them, though, you just might get access to the new selection of Spell Cards. The Forbidden Books are the Book of Eibon, De Vermis Mysteriis, Unaussprechlichen Kulten, and Cultes des Ghoules, as well as an alternate version of the Necronomicon. Also contains 13 Spell Cards and rules governing how to use them.

Name: Cultists of Cthulhu: The Dunwich Horror
Description: In this all new scenario, the Cultist is either Wilbur Whateley or an agent of his, sent to retrieve the Necronomicon from the library and use it to unleash the terrifying, invisible Dunwich Horror upon the world.

Name: Cultists of Cthulhu: The Great Race of Yith
Description: This scenario is unique in that it is not played on its own, but can be added to any other scenario, creating two Cultists working at cross purposes. The Yith want to abduct your minds to learn from you, and the Academics and the other Cultist want none of that!

Name: Cultists of Cthulhu: Character Pack
Description: Four extra characters: the hobo who hangs out on campus, the groundskeeper, a townie who tends bar at the local watering hole, and one secret character!

Name: Saus und Brau's
Description:
First she breezes, then she brews! On a wild whirling flight, Winnie the witch follows the tip of her broom. The ingredients for her favorite potion are widely scattered across mountains and valleys. To collect them, players let Winnie spin around until her broom determines the direction of her flight route. If you can elicit the right witchy magic from the magical folding books, you'll collect the ingredients the witch has flown over — but jinxed books swap places...

In Saus und Brau's, children (but also adults!) can combine the magic power of their fingertips with the sharpness of an alert mind.

Name: Contame
Description:
Contame (Tell me) is a narrative game, in which a player draws a card from deck "Histories". Then, he chooses one from deck "Actions" and five from deck "Draws". He must create a story using elements from all the cards, that includes a number of points awarded to the story-teller by the other players if he uses them correctly.
After everybody has been the story-teller, the person with more points is the winner.

Name: Mayor of Evercent Springs
Description:
In this 4-player game, the object of the game is to be appointed Mayor of Evercent Springs. This is done by becoming the first Candidate to unlock the door to Evercent Springs with your Silver Key. Each Candidate is provided with 7 Companions to assist and fight for them; players must use them to stop their opponents from reaching the door while at the same time protecting their own Candidate and Silver Keys.

At the start of the game, each Candidate has a Silver Key and one Companion from each town carries a Spare Key. If you lose both Keys, your hopes of becoming Mayor are over and you are out of the game.
During the game you will face many challenges, including opponents, pubs, holes, havens, bribes, and the Council.

The players start in their Hometowns; the door to Evercent Springs is located at the center of the board. On your turn, you move one piece. You can move your Candidate closer to the door; you can move away from an aggressive opponent’s piece; you can go to the Pub; or, you can capture an opponent’s piece and thereby eliminate it from the game. You can only capture an opponent’s piece if it’s within reach AND is lower ranked than your piece; the Council has ranked the Companions according to three categories, and the Council’s Cards show which category is now being used to rank the Companions. The players can meet with the Councillors during the game and try to have them change the category; you get to turn over a new Council’s Card and hope for the category you want. Or, you can bribe The Council, and get to choose category!

Bribing The Council is one of the Ways & Means in the game; if you have Gold Coins, you can purchase advantages. You can also purchase an Extra Step; a Hole Tile that will make a square on the board unusable; a Haven Tile to protect your Candidate; or even buy back eliminated Companions to the game. If you want to buy Ways & Means, that must be done prior to moving your piece. 
With Gold Coins, you can also make Deals with your opponents…
To get your hands on more Gold Coins, you can get lucky with the Pub cards, or eliminate opponents’ pieces. Or make good deals!
Should your Candidate be captured, and you still have the Spare Key, you’re still in the game. The Companion carrying the Spare Key is sacrificed and removed from the board, and your Candidate is being put back on your Hometown’s Street, but you can still reach the door to Evercent Springs and win the game.

If you lose your second key as well, then it’s game over for you. 
Only Candidates can unlock the door to Evercent Springs, and thereby win the game.

Strategy, tactics, luck and bribes are some of the tools to win this game; keeping your Candidate with their Silver key safe and at the same time be bold enough to first reach the door to be appointed Mayor of Evercent Springs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Your Family Rocks!
Description:
Your Family Rocks puts your family memories at the center of the board game. The game uses your own family photos as the 60 “family cards” in the game, being the first your-photos-into-cards board game, where your photos play the central role in the game mechanics, influencing the gameplay, strategy, and outcome.

Whatever is in your pictures is now fair game – you are now the creator of your own game!

The game unfolds over different dynamics about family memories (photos). The better the players perform on these dynamics - Challenges - the more Family Time they will earn. As in real life, it takes time to raise a family, so players will use their Family Time to grow their family members, values, rules and objects - each worth different prosperity points.

At the end of game, the most prosperous family wins.

—description from the publisher
